source_class.comment: A directive that a device must support to perform a certain function. A command may act upon a state, but does not necessarily act upon a state. For example, the ON command acts upon the ON/OFF state, but the GET command does not act upon any state, it simply gives a directive to retrieve a certain value. We propose here a list of commands that are relevant for the purpose of SAREF, but this list can be extended.
source_class.label: Command
source_class.name: Command

source_class.comment: A feature of interest represents any real world entity from which a property is measured.
source_class.label: Feature of interest
source_class.name: FeatureOfInterest

source_class.comment: A device built to accurately detect and display a quantity in a form readable by a human being. Further, a device of category saref:Meter that performs a saref:MeteringFunction.
source_class.label: Meter
source_class.name: Meter

source_class.comment: A device that detects and responds to events or changes in the physical environment such as light, motion, or temperature changes. Further, a device of category saref:Sensor that performs a saref:SensingFunction.
source_class.label: Sensor
source_class.name: Sensor

source_class.comment: A device of category saref:Actuator that performs an actuating function of type saref:OnOffFunction or saref:OpenCloseFunction
source_class.label: Switch
source_class.name: Switch

source_class.comment: A sensor that is used for the purpose of sensing a property of type saref:Temperature. A saref:TemperatureSensor is typically used to saref:accomplish saref:Comfort.
source_class.label: Temperature sensor
source_class.name: TemperatureSensor

source_class.comment: Heating, Ventilation and Air Conditioning (HVAC) device that provides indoor environmental comfort. A saref:HVAC is typically used to accomplish saref:Comfort.
source_class.label: HVAC
source_class.name: HVAC
